info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:16PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Powell County through 645 PM MDT... At 615 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southwest of Lincoln, or 15 miles northeast of Drummond, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Helmville. This includes Highway 200 E between mile markers 54 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
